title: 香港民族黨已向美國駐港總領事館遞交請願信！

replies.msg:
[民族黨向美國駐港總領事館遞交請願信 要求取消香港關係法]

香港民族黨於2017年8月24日下午發起向美國駐香港總領事館遞交公開請願信行動，就近日香港法院針對社運人士的判刑及其取消民選立法會議員資格的裁決，告知美國政府香港已喪失法治及司法獨立，要求美國政府盡快取消《美國—香港政策法1992》(即《香港關係法》）下美國對香港的所有特殊待遇。

民族黨於信中指出，《香港關係法》的存續，乃以英屬時代的制度和價值於主權移交後維持不變為條件。然而，過去一年香港法院的判案，充分反映香港法院已成為港共殖民政府打壓香港公民權利的共犯，法治與司法獨立已蕩然無存。
而因應廣深港高速鐵路而擬推行的「一地兩檢」割地方案，更顯示香港對其領土的司法管轄權，可按中國殖民者的意願隨意割讓。香港對其領土的司法管轄權，早已脆弱不堪，中國法律可隨時適用於香港任何區域。

因此，美國維持《香港關係法》的基礎已不復存在。《香港關係法》乃國際認可香港為自由都市的基石，而中國一直利用此國際認可謀求經濟和政治利益。因此，《香港關係法》乃中國的弱點所在，香港失去《香港關係法》下的特殊待遇，中國所受損失必遠較香港為大，香港若因而得脫離中國殖民統治，取消《香港關係法》對香港損害有限。

此外，召集人陳浩天亦解釋，取消《香港關係法》，符合美國總統杜林普向中國打「經濟戰」、實施經濟制裁的方針。失去美國對香港的特殊待遇，必然對中國造成實質而有效的嚴重經濟打擊，對美國確立其針對中國的優勢，必有幫助。

是次遞交的請願信為公開信，信後附上今年2月民族黨分別向美國總統杜林普和美國參議員盧比奧 (Marco Rubio) 撰寫的信函。請願信內容將於民族黨Facebook專頁公開，民族黨表示歡迎各界加入聯署。

[HKNP’s letter to the US Consulate: Abolish the Hong Kong Policy Act now!]

The Hong Kong National Party organised an open letter appeal to the US Consulate on 24th August. In light of the decisions made by the Hong Kong courts to re-sentence our activists and to strip our elected legislators of their posts, the HKNP wishes to make it clear that Hong Kong’s Rule of Law and judicial independence are both, in all meanings relevant, dead. Our open letter appeals to the US to abolish all special distinctions it deems Hong Kong to hold apart from China as stated in the United States-Hong Kong Policy Act.

The HKNP has made it clear in the letter that the fundamental prerequisite for the continuation of the Hong Kong Policy Act is the continuation of the systems and values as established before the 1997 Transfer of Sovereignty. The judgements handed down by the Hong Kong courts in the past year, however, is indisputable proof that Hong Kong’s judiciary is in full collusion with the Chinese Colonial forces to suppress Hong Kong’s civil rights. Hong Kong’s rule of law and judicial independence have, indisputably, disappeared.

Further, the “co-location” arrangement made for the Guangzhou-Shenzhen-Hong Kong Express Rail Link (XRL) has effectively demarcated a portion of Hong Kong’s territory to become fully Chinese soil, with the Chinese authority exercising full power over it. That Hong Kong officials would surrender the city's jurisdiction over its own territory so easily shows their powerlessness in the face of the Chinese Colonialists’ attempts at conquest, however “legal” they might be.

It is thus HKNP’s view that the Hong Kong Policy Act has now lost all of its prerequisites. The Hong Kong Policy Act has always been the foundation upon which the international community builds its trust for Hong Kong as a free city, and this perception has long been used by China to her own benefit, both economic and political. China thus risks far greater loss than Hong Kong were this Act to be abolished; indeed, were Hong Kong to gain her independence from Chinese Colonialism due to this, she would suffer little compared to what she would gain.

Our party’s convenor Andy Chan Ho-tin would also like to stress that the decision to abolish the Hong Kong Policy Act is fully concordant with US President Donald Trump’s policies to sanction China economically. By removing Hong Kong’s special status from China, the US will surely damage China’s economy significantly, and the US’ economic supremacy over China will surely be reinforced.

The HKNP has handed this letter of appeal as an open letter to the US Consulate. With it are attached two previous letters addressed to US President Donald Trump and Senator Marco Rubio in February. The contents of the letter will be published on HKNP’s Facebook page. All are welcome to add their signatures to our letter.
